      • constructRNG

        public void constructRNG​(Graph graph)
        The implementation of the RNG algorithm This method build the RNG graph using a graph without edges
        Parameters:
        graph - : a graph without edges

      • findNearestFullExplor

        public Vertex findNearestFullExplor​(Vertex newVertex,
                                    Graph graph)
        This method search the nearest vertex from "newVertex" by exploring all the vertices
        Parameters:
        newVertex - : we want to find the nearest vertex from the new one
        graph - : the graph where we seek the nearest vertex from the new one
        Returns:
        the nearest vertex from "newVertex"

      • findNearest

        public Vertex findNearest​(Vertex newVertex,
                          Graph graph)
        This method search the nearest vertex from the new vertex to add, by exploring only the neighbour's of a vertex. We start by choosing a random vertex of the graph, then we look for the nearest vertex of this random vertex among its neighbors, and do the same thing with the selected vertex until we find no nearest vertex than the selected one.
        Parameters:
        newVertex - : we want to find the nearest vertex from the new one
        graph - : the graph where we seek the nearest vertex from the new one
        Returns:
        the nearest vertex from "newVertex"

      • calculDist

        public double calculDist​(Vertex vertex1,
                         Vertex vertex2)
        Calculate the distance between 2 vertices
        Parameters:
        vertex1 -
        vertex2 -
        Returns:
        the distance between "vertex1" and "vertex2"

      • extractSubgraph

        public Graph extractSubgraph​(Graph graph,
                             Vertex nearestVertex)
        This method extract the subgraph from the main graph. It uses the nearest vertex from the new one, and select its neighbors depending on the parameter"nNeighboring". It selects at least 10 vertices.
        Parameters:
        graph - : the graph from which we will extract the subgraph.
        nearestVertex - : the vertex from which the extraction begin.
        Returns:
        subGraph : the subGraph extracted from "graph".

      • mergeSubgraph

        public void mergeSubgraph​(Graph mainGraph,
                          Graph subGraph)
        This method merges the subgraph but doesn't adds any vertex. All vertices of the subgraph need to be in the main graph before using this method.
        Parameters:
        mainGraph - : the main graph from which we extracted the subgraph.
        subGraph - : the subgraph to merge with the main graph

      • readMaxMinValueGraph

        public void readMaxMinValueGraph​(Parser parser,
                                 Graph graph)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        This method reads all the vertices in the file to find the max and the min values of a particular dimension.
        Parameters:
        graph - : the graph in which the method saves the min and the max values.
        parser - : the file that we browse to look for the min and the max values.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - for readLigne @see parser.readLine()

      • readNewVertex

        public Vertex readNewVertex​(Parser parser,
                            java.lang.Integer idNewVertex,
                            Graph graph)
        This method reads a new vertex in the file and normalizes its data, but does not adds the new vertex to the graph.
        Parameters:
        parser - : the parser which is used to read the file.
        idNewVertex - : the id of the new vertex.
        graph - : the graph that will contain later the vertex read from the file.
        Returns:
        the new vertex.

      • writeTulipFile

        public void writeTulipFile​(Graph graph,
                           java.lang.String fileName)
        This method writes the graph "graph" in a file in a format compatible with Tulipe.
        Parameters:
        graph - : the graph to write in a file.
        fileName - : name of the file where the graph will be written
